team2869.bethpage.robotics.aerialassist

Class PowerControlJaguar

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SensorBase
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PWM
        • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SafePWM
          • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Jaguar
            • team2869.bethpage.robotics.aerialassist.PowerControlJaguar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LiveWindowSendable, MotorSafety, IDevice, IDeviceController, PIDOutput, Sendable, SpeedController

    public class PowerControlJaguar
extends Jaguar
    This part of the "real world" solution for RobotDrive. A PowerControlJaguar puts out less power to allow us to compensate for one wheel spinning faster than another. The PowerControlJaguar also has a built in ramp-up / ramp-down function that is disabled by default.
    Author:
    BETHPAGE HIGH SCHOOL, 2014 TEAM #2869

    • Constructor Detail

      • PowerControlJaguar

        public PowerControlJaguar(int channel)
        Constructs a PowerControlJaguar that is wired at the specified channel, with no specified reduction (defaults to 1.0).
        Parameters:
        channel - The PWM channel on the digital module that the Jaguar is attached to. This functions like a regular jaguar with no power reduction.

      • PowerControlJaguar

        public PowerControlJaguar(int channel,
                  double factor)
        Constructs a PowerControlJaguar that is wired at the specified channel, with a set reduction factor to account for mechanical differences.
        Parameters:
        channel - The PWM channel on the digital module that the Jaguar is attached to.
        factor - The amount we wish to multiply the maximum output by. For instance, if factor = 0.9 then the maximum output is reduced by 10%

      • PowerControlJaguar

        public PowerControlJaguar(int channel,
                  double[] reduceFactors)
        Constructs a PowerControlJaguar that is wired at the specified channel, with an array of reduction factors at different speeds.
        Parameters:
        channel - The PWM channel on the digital module that the Jaguar is attached to.
        reduceFactors - should have length 10 for the reduction factors to apply for the intervals [0,0.1], [0.1, 0.2], ... [0.9, 1]

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(double speed)
        Set the PWM value to the given input, less the reduction factor. The PWM value is set using a range of -1.0 to 1.0, appropriately scaling the value for the FPGA.
        Specified by:
        set in interface SpeedController
        Overrides:
        set in class Jaguar
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed value between -1.0 and 1.0 to set.
